organization.fullName: The Affiliated Hospital Of Southwest Medical University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Registration of Acute Ischemic Stroke With Large and Medium-sized Vascular Occlusion in Southwest China(LMVOS)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Registration of Acute Ischemic Stroke With Large and Medium-sized Vascular Occlusion in Southwest China(LMVOS)

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The Affiliated Hospital Of Southwest Medical University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is designed to observe the treatment options in real-world clinical practice as well as the safety and efficacy of different treatment strategies.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: LMVOS is a prospective, real-world registry lasting for 22 years. A total of 8000 patients with large- or medium-vessel occlusion will be enrolled.

armGroups.label: Acute ischemic stroke with large- or medium-vessel occlusion
armGroups.description: Acute ischemic stroke patients with large- or medium-vessel occlusion including all treatments.

interventions.name: Visit at D90
interventions.description: Visits at 90±7 days after stroke onset were conducted by trained and blinded investigators, with face-to-face, telephone call or Internet access.
armGroupLabels: Acute ischemic stroke with large- or medium-vessel occlusion

primaryOutcomes.description: Ordinal distribution of mRS at 90±7 days; modified Rankin scale (range, 0 to 6, with a score of 0 indicating no disability, 1 no clinically significant disability, 2 slight disability, 3 moderate disability but remaining able to walk unassisted, 4 moderately severe disability, 5 severe disability, and 6 death)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of subjects with mRS 0-1 at 90±7 days.
Proportion of subjects with mRS 0-2 at 90±7 days.
Proportion of subjects with mRS 0-3 at 90±7 days.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change of National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change of National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS, a scale between 0 and 42 on which higher scores indicate more severe neurologic deficits) from baseline to 24 hours.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change of National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change of National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS, a scale between 0 and 42 on which higher scores indicate more severe neurologic deficits) from baseline to 7 days.
Time from onset of symptoms to thrombolytic therapy.
Time from the arrival of stroke patient in emergency to initiation of thrombolysis therapy.
ime from the arrival of stroke patient in emergency to groin puncture.
Time from symptom onset to the beginning of recanalization (recanalization defined as expanded TICI scale≥2b).
Time from the arrival of stroke patient in emergency to the beginning of recanalization (recanalization defined as expanded TICI scale≥2b).
Time from groin puncture to recanalization (recanalization defined as expanded TICI scale≥2b).

otherOutcomes.measure: Incidence of clinically significant intracranial hemorrhage
otherOutcomes.description: Incidence of sICH (Heidelberg criteria) measured at 36 hours
Incidence of any intracranial hemorrhage (Heidelberg criteria) measured at 36 hours
Complications related to intravenous thrombolysis during hospitalization
Complications related to intravenous thrombolysis during hospitalization

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

The clinical diagnosis is acute ischemic stroke with large- or medium- vessel occlusion (the criteria followed the Chinese Guidelines for the Diagnosis and Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke 2018).

Informed consent from the patient or surrogate.

Exclusion Criteria:

No additional exclusion criteria.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients with acute ischemic stroke due to large- or medium-vessel occlusion will be enrolled and no additional exclusion criteria are set.

overallOfficials.name: Zhengzhou Yuan, MD
overallOfficials.affiliation: Department of Neurology, Affiliated Hospital of Southwest Medical University, LuZhou, China.

locations.facility: Affiliated Hospital of Southwest Medical University
